summary: In this context, 1,2,4-trimethylbenzene and 4-xylene are both categorized as aromatic hydrocarbons and included in the assessment of volatile organic compounds (VOCs) in dwellings. They contribute to the global VOC score, which quantifies air pollutants based on their elevated concentrations. However, the context does not provide specific details on their individual interactions or health effects beyond their classification as part of the same group of compounds.
